question: An object is executing uniform circular motion. Which of the following quantities remain(s) constant during the object’s motion?
We can hear a whooshing sound when we hold a spiral conch shell near our ears. What is the most likely reason behind this?
answers: The sound we hear is echoing of our blood rushing through the blood vessels of our ear
The sound is generated by air flowing through the shell – in and out
The ambient noise around us resonates inside the shell
None of the reasons mentioned in statements A, B or C is correct
